title: Thermal conductivity - time for energy transfer

content.question: A cylindrical metal rod of length <math alttext="1.3 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math> and diameter <math alttext="0.45 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.45</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math> connects a hot reservoir to a cold reservoir, as shown in the diagram. The rod has a thermal conductivity of <math alttext="400 watts per meter kelvin" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>400</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>W/</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>K</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> and a specific heat of <math alttext="720 joules per kilogram kelvin" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>720</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>J/</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>K</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>. The hot reservoir is held at a constant temperature of <math alttext="200 kelvins" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>200</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></math> and the cold reservoir is held at a constant temperature of <math alttext="50 kelvins" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>50</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></math>. Which of the following is approximately equal to the time required to transfer <math alttext="15 kilojoules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>15</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kJ</mtext></math> of thermal energy from the hot reservoir to the cold reservoir?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
